contentList.content: You gain a +5 bonus to Initiative and can't be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SURPRISED">Surprised</LSTag>.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Light Armour and your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LuckPoint">Luck Points</LSTag>, which you can use to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, or to make an enemy reroll their Attack Rolls.

You learn 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the bard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Charisma.

You learn 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the cleric spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Wisdom.

You learn 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the druid spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Wisdom.

You learn 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the sorcerer spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Charisma.

You learn 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the warlock spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Charisma.

You learn 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the wizard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Intelligence.
When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in 3 <LSTag Tooltip="Skill">Skills</LSTag> of your choice.
Your hit point maximum increases by 2 for every level you have gained.

When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> is added twice to the damage and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
You increase one Ability by 2, or two Abilities by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance Checks.

Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump distance also increases by 50%.
You gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Charger_Attack">Charger: Weapon Attack</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Charger_Push">Charger: Shove</LSTag>.

When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

When attacked while wielding a <LSTag Tooltip="Finesse">Finesse Weapon</LSTag> you're <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>, possibly causing the attack to miss.

You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if your weapons aren't <LSTag Tooltip="Light">Light</LSTag>, and you gain a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> while wielding a melee weapon in each hand. You cannot dual-wield <LSTag Tooltip="Heavy">Heavy</LSTag> weapons.

You gain Advantage on Perception Checks made to detect hidden objects and on Saving Throws made to avoid or resist traps.

You gain Resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

Your Constitution increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You regain full hit points each time you take a Short Rest.
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to a damage type of your choice. When you cast spells of that type, you cannot roll a 1.

When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus action that turn.

Attacks with melee weapons you are Proficient with, and are wielding in both hands, can deal an additional 10 damage at the cost of a -5 Attack Roll penalty. (You can toggle this on and off.)
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Heavy Armour and your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

When a creature casts a spell within melee range of you, you have Advantage on any Saving Throw against it, and you can use a reaction to immediately make an attack against the caster.

Enemies you hit have Disadvantage on Concentration Saving Throws.

You learn two manoeuvres from the Battle Master subclass and gain a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SuperiorityDie">Superiority Die</LSTag> to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Your movement speed increases, and difficult terrain doesn't slow you down when you Dash.

If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke Opportunity Attacks from your target.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Medium Armour and shields, and your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You increase an <LSTag Tooltip="Abilities">Ability</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20, and gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in that Ability's <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
You learn two <LSTag Tooltip="RitualSpell">ritual spells</LSTag> of your choice.

When an enemy within melee range attacks an ally, you can use a reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel Feat.

You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks, and when you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

Your ranged weapon attacks do not receive penalties from High Ground Rules.

Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage. (You can toggle this on or off.)

You learn a <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrip</LSTag>, and the number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with spells is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

You gain Advantage on Saving Throws to maintain Concentration on a spell.

You can also use a reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.

When you wear Medium Armour, it doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>. The bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> you can gain from your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> also becomes +3 instead of +2.

When attacking with a glaive, halberd, quarterstaff, or spear, you can use a bonus action to attack with the butt of your weapon.

You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

You gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> while wielding a shield. If a spell forces you to make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage. On a failed Saving Throw, you only take half damage. On a successful Saving Throw, you don't take any damage.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with four weapons of your choice, and your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You can spend 10 minutes <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_InspiringLeader">Inspiring</LSTag> your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight.

Prerequisite: Dexterity 13 or higher
You can try to hide when you are only <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING_LIGHTLY_OBSCURED">Lightly Obscured</LSTag>.
When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag>, your attack doesn't reveal your position.
Dim light doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">checks</LSTag> made with sight.
